author: Rebecca Cohen
description: A Colorado man suspected of killing his wife was charged Friday for the second time with first degree murder in her 2020 death, the Twelfth Judicial District Attorney's Office said in a release.
title: Colorado man charged again with first degree murder of wife who went missing in 2020

author: Reuters
description: Walmart has agreed to pay $10 million to settle a U.S.
title: Walmart to pay $10 million to settle lawsuit over money transfer fraud

author: Daniel Arkin
description: Diddy’s trial was abbreviated this week.
title: Jurors see more texts between Cassie and Diddy as prosecutors prepare to rest case

author: Reuters
description: (Reuters) — Apple was sued on Friday by shareholders in a proposed securities fraud class action that accused it of downplaying how long it needed to integrate advanced artificial intelligence into its Siri voice assistant, hurting iPhone sales and its stock price
title: Apple sued by shareholders for allegedly overstating AI progress

description: Watch live coverage as Vice President JD Vance delivers remarks during a visit to Los Angeles, where clashes between protesters and law enforcement officials have become a focal point of the Trump administration’s immigration agenda.
title: Vance delivers remarks in Los Angeles amid immigration clashes

author: The Associated Press
description: Legendary Cubs slugger Sammy Sosa returned to Wrigley Field for the first time in more than 20 years on Friday before Chicago's afternoon game with the Seattle Mariners.
title: Sammy Sosa returns to Wrigley Field for first time in more than two decades

author: The Politics Desk
description: Vice President JD Vance is wading into the immigration thicket today by traveling to Los Angeles, where Marines and National Guard forces have been deployed to provide backup for federal agents executing raids.
title: JD Vance wades into the immigration thicket: From the Politics Desk

author: Sean Conlon, CNBC
description: The S&P 500 fell on Friday as investors monitored the latest developments out of the Middle East.
title: S&P 500 posts third straight losing day as traders eye Middle East tensions, Trump’s next steps

author: Erik Ortiz
description: A federal appeals court on Friday ruled unanimously in favor of a coalition of Louisiana parents who sued to block a state law that requires public schools and colleges to display the Ten Commandments in classrooms.
title: Louisiana's Ten Commandments law in public schools blocked by federal appeals court

author: Dan De Luce
description: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi told NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell that his government doesn’t know “how we can trust” the U.S. after Israel's strikes.
title: Iran not sure it can trust America after Israeli attack, Iran’s foreign minister tells NBC News

description: NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell interviewed Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi in Geneva, Switzerland about the growing tensions between Israel, the U.S. and Iran. Araghchi said Iran does not know if the U.S. can be trusted anymore and calls the Trump administrations’ actions a “betrayal to diplomacy.”
title: Iranian foreign minister on U.S.: ‘We don’t know how we can trust them anymore’

author: Emily Berk
description: A federal judge in Massachusetts on Friday again blocked the government’s attempt to revoke Harvard’s ability to enroll international students.
title: Judge again blocks Trump administration from halting Harvard's enrolling international students

author: Samantha Subin, CNBC
description: Tesla’s long-overdue robotaxi is finally hitting the streets this weekend, but the rollout may face some roadblocks
title: Everything we know about Tesla's robotaxi launch in Austin

author: Megan Shannon
description: President Donald Trump’s two-week timeline to decide on whether the U.S. will strike Iran’s nuclear sites is a familiar one — it’s one he’s repeatedly used since his first term in office.
title: Two weeks' notice: Trump's deadline on Iran is a familiar one

description: Sean "Diddy" Combs' former assistant, Brendan Paul, took the witness stand for the ongoing sex trafficking trial of the music mogul and testified that he was asked to buy thousands of dollars worth of drugs. NBC News' Chloe Melas reports on the questioning Paul faced and how both sides may be aiming to wrap their arguments next week.
title: Former assistant testifies about buying drugs for Sean 'Diddy' Combs

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and his fiancée, Emmy-winning journalist Lauren Sanchez, are getting set to tie the knot in one of the year’s most anticipated weddings.“(I’m) very excited about it,” she told Hoda Kotb and Savannah Guthrie while appearing on TODAY in November 2024.
title: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez’s wedding in Venice is approaching: Everything to Know

author: Joseph Lamour, TODAY
description: A Kroger in Atlanta, Georgia is going viral for its Juneteenth cake offerings.
title: Kroger’s Juneteenth cakes spark backlash: ‘This is a mockery!’

author: Chrissy Callahan, TODAY
description: Lizzo shared new details about her recent weight loss journey and got real about weight-loss drugs in a new appearance on the “Just Trish” podcast, hosted by internet personality Trisha Paytas
title: Lizzo says she tried Ozempic amid weight loss journey

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Rapper Fat Joe is accused of forcing his former hype man to engage in thousands of sex acts with women in a $20 million federal civil lawsuit that also alleges he was underpaid, denied songwriting credits and threatened.
title: Fat Joe's former hype man alleges he was forced into 4,000 sex acts by rapper

author: Erin Doherty, CNBC
description: The Supreme Court on Friday rejected a request from two toy companies to expedite their challenge to President Donald Trump’s tariffs
title: Supreme Court rejects toy makers' request to fast track challenge to Trump's tariffs

author: The Associated Press
description: U.S. television ratings for the Stanley Cup Final rematch between the Florida Panthers and the Edmonton Oilers declined from their first matchup a year ago
title: Stanley Cup Final ratings drop from last year's contest

author: The Associated Press
description: Peak sunshine has arrived in the Northern Hemisphere — the summer solstice
title: The summer solstice is here. What to know about the longest day of the year

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Sara Burack, who starred in the Netflix series "Million Dollar Beach House," was killed in an apparent hit-and-run on Thursday, police said.
title: Sara Burack, star of Netflix's 'Million Dollar Beach House,' killed in apparent Hamptons hit-and-run

author: Henry J. Gomez
description: Rep. Max Miller, R-Ohio, said he was “run off the road” Thursday morning in a Cleveland suburb by a man who waved a Palestinian flag and threatened to kill Miller and his young daughter.
title: Suspect arrested after Rep. Max Miller says he was 'run off the road' by man waving a Palestinian flag

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: Supreme Court upholds Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming care for minors, potentially affecting 112,000 transgender youth in states with similar laws.
title: Supreme Court decision 'sanctions discrimination,' parent of trans teen says

author: Ganesh Rao, CNBC
description: Tesla has inked its first deal to build a grid-scale battery power plant in China amid a strained trading relationship between Beijing and Washington
title: Tesla inks first deal to build China's largest grid-scale battery power plant

author: Viola Flowers
description: A jury in Fulton County, Georgia, awarded $2.25 million in damages to the parents of a baby who was decapitated during delivery and whose autopsy was posted on social media without his parents' consent.
title: Jury awards $2.25 million to parents of decapitated baby whose autopsy was shared on social media

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — Liberal Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson criticized her colleagues on Friday in a scathing dissent on a case involving vehicle emissions regulations
title: In a scathing dissent, Justice Jackson says the Supreme Court gives the impression it favors 'moneyed interests'

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump on Friday posted on social media a call for a special prosecutor to investigate the 2020 election, which he lost to former President Joe Biden more than four years ago
title: Trump posts on social media calling for a special prosecutor to investigate the 2020 election

author: Aria Bendix
description: The first day of summer is ushering a dangerous heat wave in several regions across the United States
title: Record-setting heat wave headed to central, Midwest and eastern U.S.

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Sherri Papini, the California woman who was convicted in 2022 for faking her kidnapping and lying to the FBI, is again claiming that she was in fact kidnapped
title: Sherri Papini, convicted of faking her own kidnapping, claims again she was kidnapped

author: Rebecca Shabad
description: Vice President JD Vance will travel to Los Angeles on Friday for a visit to a city where clashes between protesters and law enforcement officials have become a focal point of the opposition to the Trump administration’s immigration agenda
title: Vance to travel to Los Angeles

author: Michael Rosenfield, NBC Boston
description: A juror in the Karen Read trial described the experience in the high-profile case, saying at first she thought the defendant could be guilty of manslaughter
title: Deliberations were ‘overwhelming': Juror in Karen Read trial describes experience

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Friday ruled that victims of terrorism can sue Palestinian entities in U.S. courts, upholding a law passed by Congress that allows such claims to be brought.
title: Supreme Court allows terrorism victims to sue Palestinian entities

author: Alexander Smith
description: If Trump bombs Iran's Fordo nuclear enrichment site, the main risk would be from the Massive Ordnance Penetrator bomb itself rather than radiation or chemicals.
title: What could happen if Trump does decide to bomb Iran's main nuclear site

author: Matt Lavietes
description: A federal judge has denied a defense motion to release R. Kelly to home confinement after what lawyers called an assassination attempt against the disgraced musician.
title: Judge denies defense motion to move R. Kelly to home detention

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: Two of the brightest stars in music took the City of Lights by storm
title: See Miley Cyrus' Surprise Duet With Beyoncé at ‘Cowboy Carter’ Tour Stop in Paris

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: The Indiana Pacers forced a Game 7 of the NBA Finals against the Oklahoma City Thunder.
title: The ‘margin’ stat that was the biggest key to the Indiana Pacers saving their season

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: Fed Governor Christopher Waller's remarks come as President Trump is pressuring the Fed Chair Jay Powell to cut interest rates.
title: Fed should consider cutting rates as early as July, official says

author: The Associated Press
description: Rays pitcher Hunter Bigge was carted off the field in a frightening scene and taken to a hospital after getting struck in the face by a foul ball lined into the Tampa Bay dugout Thursday night.
title: Tampa Bay Rays pitcher taken to hospital after getting hit by foul ball in dugout

description: As Iran and Israel trade another round of attacks, President Donald Trump is setting a new 2-week timetable for his decision on wether to order U.S. military action in Iran. It comes after the president repeatedly suggested strikes could be imminent saying, “I may do it, I may not do it.” NBC’s Peter Alexander reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Sets 2-Week Timeline to Decide on US Involvement in Iran

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Donald Trump said he would decide whether the U.S. should take action in Iran within two weeks.
title: Trump weighs Iran action and appeals court rules on California National Guard: Morning Rundown

author: The Associated Press
description: Suga, a rapper and songwriter in the global K-pop sensation BTS, has been discharged from South Korea's mandatory military service, marking the official return of all seven members from their enlistment duties.
title: All 7 BTS members are now done with mandatory service

author: Patrick Smith
description: The Minnesota lawmaker who survived an attack by a gunman on his doorstep is still in a critical condition and has revealed details of the terrifying moment he and his wife were shot multiple times.
title: Minnesota lawmaker shot 9 times at his home in 'targeted' attack is in a critical condition

description: Court was adjourned early on Wednesday morning after a juror was sick with vertigo.
title: Sean Combs' former assistant Brendan Paul to testify as prosecution wraps up case

author: Patrick Smith
description: Singer Chris Brown denies charges of attacking a music producer with a bottle in a nightclub two years ago at a court hearing in London on Friday.
title: Chris Brown pleads not guilty to 2023 nightclub bottle attack charge in U.K. court

author: Gretchen Morgenson
description: A massive hack of a UnitedHealth unit set off a chain of events that has left some doctors’ practices on financial life support.
title: Taking on Goliath: Brain surgeon's clash with UnitedHealthcare shows insurer's hardball tactics

author: Ben Kamisar
description: As high-profile longtime New York Democrats flock to Gov.
title: How opponents on the left are banding together to try to stop Andrew Cuomo in New York City

author: Reuters
description: One person was killed and at least 14 were injured when Russian drones attacked the Ukrainian Black Sea city of Odesa overnight, local authorities said Friday.
title: One killed and 14 injured in overnight Russian attack on Ukraine's Odesa

author: The Associated Press
description: Authorities in southern Mexico were still assessing damage and watching rising rivers as rain from the remnants of Hurricane Erick doused the region.
title: Mexico assesses damage from Hurricane Erick as rising rivers leave at least 1 dead

author: The Associated Press
description: A British judge on Thursday sentenced a Chinese Ph.D. student to a minimum of 24 years in prison for drugging and raping 10 women in England and China.
title: Chinese Ph.D. student sentenced to at least 24 years in prison for raping multiple women

author: The Associated Press
description: Thousands of supporters of Myanmar’s jailed former leader Aung San Suu Kyi celebrated her 80th birthday Thursday by attempting to set a world record for the most birthday greeting videos.
title: Supporters of Myanmar's jailed leader strive to set world record to honor her 80th birthday

author: The Associated Press
description: Ecuador's government is preparing to auction off 14 new oil blocks — covering more than 2 million hectares of rainforest — in a 2026 bidding round known as "Sur Oriente."
title: California is to examine its Amazon oil ties following pleas from Indigenous leaders from Ecuador

author: Dennis Romero
description: A man found with a Taser, rope and duct tape who was seen in the neighborhood has been accused of stalking and attempting to kidnap the mayor of Memphis, Tennessee.
title: Man with Taser, tape and rope accused of stalking, trying to kidnap Memphis mayor

author: Andrew Greif
description: Perhaps it was only appropriate that an NBA postseason no one would have predicted could not end without yet another plot twist
title: Pacers rout Thunder, force first NBA Finals Game 7 since 2016

author: Dennis Romero
description: President Donald Trump is within his rights to deploy the California National Guard amid protests against federal law enforcement over immigration raids, an appeals court ruled Thursday night.
title: Appeals court says Trump can keep control of California National Guard troops

author: Reuters
description: A federal judge on Thursday blocked President Donald Trump‘s administration from forcing 20 Democratic-led states to cooperate with immigration enforcement in order to receive billions of dollars in transportation grant funding
title: Judge blocks Trump plan to tie states' transportation funds to immigration enforcement

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: President Donald Trump did not formally mark Juneteenth on Thursday, complaining instead that there are "too many non-working holidays," while his predecessor, Joe Biden, celebrated the occasion at a Black church in Texas
title: Trump says U.S. has 'too many non-working holidays' on Juneteenth
